description: Pre-test for chart to task scenario - assesses baseline understanding of matching analytical tasks with charts

questions.question_text: A teacher wants students to compare sales performance across five regions. Which chart type best serves this task?

options.text: Bar or column chart for direct comparison

questions.explanation: Comparison tasks are best served by bar or column charts which make it easy to compare values across categories.

questions.question_text: You need to show whether customer satisfaction is improving over the past 12 months. What type of analytical task is this?
questions.explanation: Showing change over time is a trend analysis task, best served by line or area charts.

questions.question_text: Someone wants to understand the spread of delivery times (min, max, median, quartiles). What is the analytical intent?
questions.explanation: Understanding spread, quartiles, and range is distribution analysis, often shown with histograms or box plots.

questions.question_text: What's the difference between ranking regions by sales vs. showing sales trends over time?

options.text: There is no difference - both use the same chart
Ranking is a comparison task; trends show change over time
Ranking needs a pie chart; trends need a bar chart

questions.explanation: Ranking is about comparing static values (use bars), while trends show temporal change (use lines). These are different analytical tasks.
